ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Lag in zones
ygData.msgSnippet: Current System Specs: P4 1.8 512meg RamBus Geforce 3 4xAGP 64megs DSL Options settings: 1280 resolution All Models Mip Mapping Texture Compression Texture
ygData.messageBody:
Current System Specs:

P4 1.8
512meg RamBus
Geforce 3 4xAGP 64megs
DSL

Options settings:

1280 resolution
All Models
Mip Mapping
Texture Compression
Texture Caching
High Graphics

Sure I still get lag in a few areas and I don't have full cliping plane.
But I have it as a resonable distance and its pretty seemless. Some zones
were really laggy when the Luclin was released, however, now its pretty much
seemless in old, kunark and velious zones. Some aspects of Luclin lag
occasionally but nothing to complain about.

I do find that if your running a card with Anti-Aliasing the spell graphics
really tend to have an effect on the performance of the graphics card. I'm
sure many of you have noticed when you have spell graphics on and a Mage/Wiz
does a Fire Rain spell most of us are instantly hit with mega lag. Same
thing happens toward most spells when AA is turned on. Leave it off and it
runs nice and smooth.

I know the specs are on the high side, but I'd gladly help anyone in
pointing them to low cost solutions.

DuHase

-----Original Message-----
From: mlockridge01 [mailto:MLockridge01@...]
Sent: Monday, January 07, 2002 12:21 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Lag in zones


I just added the necessary memory to max out my system.
Unfortunately, that max is 256. I would love to go to 512 or more,
but that would require a new system.

Things have improved with the added memory, but I still get lots of
lag in Rivervale, and similar town type zones. My graphics card is an
Nvidia TNT 64 (don't know what the 64 means, it is 32meg). It is the
best I could find last year for the money I had, and more than
adequate for the game at that time. I needed pci, so my choices were
a bit limited. More than that, my knowledge was much less in those
days.

I am curious as to what kinds of graphics cards people use, and
whether or not they are experiencing lag in zones like Rivervale in
spite of having a pretty good system.

Anyone have a killer rig, and still find lag or other problems? I
just wonder how much is the game, how much my now low end system.

Barto Proudfoot
